title: The random disconnect error and RADS error.
body:
**Small background information leading up to my main problem:**
Okay, so I'm sure I'm not the first to encounter this error, but last night I was having problems with League. Whenever I opened the client, it would tell me after a few seconds (whether I was logged in or not) that I couldn't connect to the League servers. It prompted me to either restart or shutdown the client. I tried restarting a few times, but the error continued. I ended up going to this page: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761944-Login-Issues to attempt to fix this issue, but none of the solutions worked. I also tried the Hextech Repair Tool, but none of the fixes on that worked either. So I ended up attempting to reinstall League fresh (because whenever the Hextech Tool tried it failed for some reason). After I reinstalled the game, I attempted to launch it from the client I was able to use (the old one), but it just gave me the RADS error. I then went around to try and solve that as well. Now a day later, I have the game reinstalled, possibly even have the disconnecting error fixed (or maybe Riot fixed it in the time I was away), but I'm still getting this RADS error.

**Things I've tried to fix the RADS error:**
I tried launching the game as administrator as well as launching the admin client. _Didn't work._
I tried setting my DNS like basically every solution I found said. I set it too 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.4.4 as well as one said to try 8.8.8.8 and 8.8.8.4. _Didn't work._
I attempted to resync my PC's clock (like it said to do on the support page), but I encountered a problem with it. I never actually found any sort of update button to force an update manually and if I tried to do it through the command prompt it gave me this: 
> **System error 5 has occurred. Access is denied.**

I also tried to resync through the Hextech Repair Tool, but that just gave me another error.
I couldn't update Internet Explorer, because I'm on a Windows 10 computer and that was replaced with Microsoft Edge. 
I tried launching League with Microsoft Edge open. _Didn't work._
I tried this even though it was from 2012: http://forums.na.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=2540385 , but I couldn't find the listed "rads_user_kernel.exe" file they where speaking of. Most of the other solutions where either impossible to do, or just didn't work.
I tried this: http://forums.euw.leagueoflegends.com/board/showthread.php?t=1435570 ,  but I changed the file to note that I'm on the NA servers instead of the EUW servers. Didn't work.

If there is anyway to possibly fix this I would appreciate it a great deal. If any more information is needed let me know. I'm not the best when it comes to troubleshooting, so I don't know if I did everything the way I was supposed to.

Also apologies for the wall of text, I just wanted to give as much information as I could on my situation.

replies.body:
There could be a number of other network settings that can potentially conflict with League. Working through our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in its entirety would be a good next step in ensuring all your local settings are 100% good to go.

Let me know if this caused any change.

I did everything on this list, the only thing I'm waiting on now is checking for any packet loss. Nothing seemed to work, but I did notice something weird. In my **C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects** folder as well as my **C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\solutions** folder, where both entirely empty. Could this be something that can be causing this issue? (Also note that even since I reinstalled the game, I've never gotten to the point for it to redownload any of the patches.)

I'll let you know as soon as my Netalyzr is finished checking for packet loss.

If you need the information, here it is from the Netalyzr check.

**[LINK REDACTED]**

Those empty folders won't cause any issues, also I had to remove your Netalyzr link because it listed your real IP address, which shouldn't be shared publicly, though nothing looked out of place on that netalyzr. 

I'd recommend running a set of logs using our [HRT App](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367), then attach the logs to a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so one of our techs can assist you from here.
